text: Get the security team together.
I can't talk you into coming with us?
I think he's pulling your leg. Believe it or not, Worf's developing a sense of humor.
No.
That changes nothing. The captain and Commander Riker must be in trouble, or they'd be here.
That's a pointless discussion. You could have been on the bridge and it still might have happened.
We can switch off.
We've been challenged to a friendly game of Parrises Squares by some of the maintenance personnel -- want to join us on the starbase?
What about the Bynars?
You have three ships in here. We need one of them now.
As the Mistress Beata is so fond of saying -- good question.
Captain, we're receiving an audio signal from Angel One.
Certain cultures consider perfume an aphrodisiac.
Certainly, sir.
Commander... ?
Energize!
Energize!
Hailing frequencies open.
Haven't you been paying attention, Ramsey? You're scheduled to be executed tomorrow.
Hiding place? Why are they in hiding?
I'll inform the commander.  One thing before we go. You said you were expecting us. Why?
Is that supposed to be the fancy name for murder on this planet?
Lieutenant Yar to Enterprise.
None of which is any longer your concern, Mister Ramsey. Call the others in, please. It's time to leave.
Prepare to beam three back to our previous location, Geordi. After we regroup with Commander Riker, we'll return to the ship.
Set phasers to stun.
Some show of force. The Enterprise may be able to fly on autopilot. But with that virus knocking down our crew, we're going to be in sorry shape if things turn ugly.
They've broken off transmission.
Things must be worse up there than we thought.
This is Yar.
Three to beam to the location of that platinum trace, Geordi.
What reason could we possibly have to deceive you?
Where are the other survivors, Mister Ramsey?
Which means there's still time for us to do something.
Yes. Tricorder doesn't show any listening devices or anything else of a threatening nature
Captain!
Commander, I recommend a minimum complement.
Commander.
Data, you're sturdy, but you're not indestructible.
Doctor Crusher.
Enterprise, this is Lieutenant Yar.
Good. Now Geordi can get us out of here.
He can't answer you, Captain. Commander Riker has been encased is a cube of complex lucinium compound.
I can't find them.
I'm surprised either of them survived.
If Data's calculations are correct, the next sphere should show itself in two minutes.
If it's found out -- it encases the subject to await a more detailed interrogation later. Clever.
In any war, natural disaster, or even the most virulent plague, there are always survivors.
It's evasive. Data -- I need you. Set your phaser on kill. I'll fire so that it will move left, and you get it.
It's got a deflector shield.
It's undamaged.
Keep working. I'll look for Captain Picard and Doctor Crusher.
Maybe you should wait here while Data and I search for Doctor Crusher and Captain Picard.
Maybe. Let's spread out a little.
Mine's out too.
None.
Probably developed here.
Spread out. We'll concentrate our fire and try to collapse its shield.
That one took everything we had. I don't know how we'll handle the next one.
This one is different.
Tritanium. It's been melted.
We had better find a defensive position. If Data's right --
We know, Captain.
We'll do it just like before.
We'll keep the first landing party small and mobile. Until I'm confident that whatever killed the inhabitants of this planet isn't still down there.
We're going to have company in thirty seconds. And this time... I don't know how we're going to stop it.
Weapons systems?
Whatever it was, it's beyond our technology.
You turned down your own command to take this assignment?
You're right, they keep getting better.
Do you want the arriving vessel on Main Viewer, sir? It is only a thousand kilometers away now...
Excuse, Captain, but the unidentified starship is continuing in, still no signal at all...
Hailing frequencies closed.
Hailing frequencies open, sir.
Hailing frequencies open, sir.
Hailing frequencies open, sir.
Hailing frequencies open, sir.
Intruder alert, sir...
Negative on that, Captain. But they have identified their Captain as "Bok," DaiMon Bok.
Now open, sir.
Shields up, sir. No way to beam over help.
Sir... I have the Stargazer.
Six photon torpedoes short, sir, probably used when the Captain destroyed his Ferengi attacker seven years ago. Otherwise fully armed.
We've lost him, sir...
Yar to Enterprise. All clear, sir.
You transferred some of his belongings from the Stargazer... ?
-- The captain is well aware of the gravity of the situation, Commander.
Bridge to Holodeck. We're approaching Torona Four.
Captain!
Frequencies open, sir.
Frequencies open.
Most likely. But it's long range. Can't be certain where it's originating..
Probes! I'm reading several of them, sir. All locked on to us.
We're being probed, sir.
Whalen.
A wonderful fairy tale.
Aldean shields still up. Hailing frequencies open. No response.
Aye, sir.
Frequencies open, sir.
Not yet, sir.
Open, sir.
Sir, Radue is hailing us.
What's so interesting about this system?
Where is it supposed to be?
Aikido, vanish.
Aikido. One.
Any last minute instructions, sir?
But it will feel real when it hits you.
Captain. Deanna.
Fine, Captain...  ... but they're showing some signs of wear.
I could create two -- even three, but one is really enough. As you fight with it, it learns, and before long it knows exactly how to defeat you.
I judge it excellent, sir.
I know I could win. Not that I'd take her life, of course, but I'd be glad to embarrass her. The idea of accusing me...
I think you should know that there is no physical training anywhere that matches Starfleet, especially its security people.
I'd like to do it, sir.  As a sign of respect, perhaps.
Impossible, Yareena. I am a career Starfleet officer...
In my world it's a greater honor to refuse to ...

Interesting? Data, I grew up on a failed colony, completely lawless, mad, where people took what they wanted. This meant males for the reason they're bigger, stronger...  And that's why I chose Starfleet security, I guess.
It forces us to keep improving.
It involves nothing I'm ashamed of!  In fact, you may discover that the very worst move of your life was when you threw in with flesh and blood humans.
It won't move until my actions activate it.
It's not a real person, Lutan. It has no life. Everything it does is controlled by computer.
It's such a... a waste!
My duty, Lutan.
No, there would be... complications.
Nothing concealed, sir.
Nothing, sir.
Of course I don't, Data! As Troi pointed out to me, I'm attracted to him but that is entirely different.
On no, no...
She won't budge. She loves him -- without reservation.  And she thinks I love him too.
Sorry, I am required to inspect...
That's so beautiful.  And so sad for you. You've lost everything.
These I understand.
They have, sir. Precisely. And they're standing by for your signal.
They've insisted on using their own transporter device, sir...
This way, please.

Those were my early interests... strength, daring, dominant males... and that's why Lutan attracts me. To me, he's like a Federation Olympic Games hero. But do I want to become his so-called "First One," marry him? That would be nonsense!
Troi! I'm your friend and you tricked me!
We're too late; she's growing cold.
Which means they desperately need the vaccine, sir. And I know I can win this challenge...
Who am I? Do you hear me?
Yareena, I fight for the vaccine... That's the truth.
Yareena, my acceptance had nothing to do with Lutan.
Yes, he would indeed. He's almost crippled with needs, the poor handsome dear.
Yes, of course it made me feel good...
... He's launching!
Captain, there's an unauthorized entry in Main Shuttlebay.
He's out of transporter range.
I'll find him a comfortable place on Deck Fifteen, sir.
The computer reads the I.D. number of... Jake Kurland.
Visual on Main Viewer.
But how did Data escape that thing? Or Lore?
By which Doctor Soong left proof behind that his experiment did work.
Captain, I have a subspace reply to your request.  Starfleet considers it vital we begin our ship's computer upgrade at Starbase Armus Nine on schedule.
Confirming Class M reading there. But...  ... but the sensors aren't showing any life readings. Not even vegetation.
Data, I can't understand how you can hold the memories of four hundred eleven people. If that means every experience, every day they lived...
Data, any idea at all why you were given the colonists' memories?
Data, are you expecting Lore to come up here? He left your quarters some time ago.
Deflector shields holding, sir.
It's such a strange place to be born.
It's transmitting no ID signal, Captain...
My Turbo-sensors say he went to Deck One...  Worf?
No life readings in here either, sir.
Recording signal now locked onto the Enterprise, sir.
Sensors show Data just now entering a turbolift, sir.
Speaking strictly as security chief, Captain... how much can you trust Data now?
Still no ID transmitted, sir. Also, no answer to our inquiries.
Thank you for explaining that, sir.
Then this very spot was your birthplace...
Until he tried to make Asimov's dream of a positronic brain come true.
You were born and became fully knowledgeable at the same instant!
You were just lying out in the open? No identity record, no instructions... ?
I.. I was at...  This is crazy! I was at the colony where I grew up ... being chased by a rape gang...
Now, run. This isn't a safe place at all.
Plus some genuine fear, Captain. You can't notice what's outside without feeling some of that.
You darling, what are you doing here?
You're telling us that's a kittycat?
Got them, sir...
I'm certain I could disable their ship with a phaser burst, Captain.
Okay, let's bring it in.
That's what I wondered about. She's on her way now.
The Bride and Groom go naked?!
Tractor beam ready.
We learned the rest of the story in security training. Some Tarellians made it to other worlds only to die along with the populations they infected.
We're not sure. I'm holding it in stasis until we can register its exact nature. It's listed as a gift for Counselor Troi.
Yes sir. There's an object of some kind beaming in from Haven.
Aye, sir.
Aye, sir.
Bridge -- we have a hostage situation on Deck Seventeen.
Bridge, this is Lieutenant Yar -- disregard. The situation is under control.
By order of the captain, you are confined to Security.
Captain, he has a phaser aimed directly at the Dilithium Crystal Chamber. At that range, one blast and...
Captain, should I stay at my tactical position or lead the security team?
Captain. Korris is in Main Engineering.
GO BACK!
Hailing frequencies open.
He's on the second level. Armed with a phaser. We do not have a clear field of fire.
I don't think that's a good idea. Right now he's running on adrenalin. Let it cool. There's no place he can go.
I thought for a minute we had a problem.
I'll need your weapons.
It's not good. I can't get locked on.
Lieutenant Yar to bridge. There has been an escape. Two of my security are dead. So is Konmel. Korris is loose -- and armed.
Sir... Sensors indicate several recent photon explosions and heavy phaser activity.
Step to the side.
That would destroy the Enterprise and him along with it.
The captain wants those two taken into custody.
They are with Worf on Deck Seventeen.
Wait him out.
Worf.
Yes, sir -- next to the auxiliary turbolift to the Battle Bridge. Shall I alert Lieutenant Worf?
Yes. It looked like Korris was going to hold the little girl as a hostage.
Captain, you had better look at this.
Captain... if you weren't a captain...
I... well, this sounds strange, but... I'm in the penalty box.
In "Q"'s penalty box. As I said, it sounds strange but it definitely isn't. Somehow I know that one more penalty... by me or anyone... and I'm gone.
My phaser's gone. Worf, are you armed?
No, I'm sorry. It's so frustrating to be controlled like this...
Please do not keep reminding me...
Shields and deflectors, up, sir.
Sir! Over here... !
There has been no interruption in course or speed. Both have remained constant. Captain -- it's as though we never stopped.
What the hell am I doing? Crying?
Where's Commander Riker?
You've gone too far.
All non-essential personnel have been moved to the most distant areas of the ship, sir.
And third in command of the Enterprise.
Aye, sir.
Aye, sir.
Coordinates set, sir.
Coordinates set.
Hailing frequencies open, sir.
I'm going in.
It's slowing down.
Let me try.
Mandl holds advanced degrees in Computer Science as well as Artificial Intelligence. It's possible.
No equipment malfunction on either end, sir. They are receiving.

Only the victim had the required expertise. But Malencon did work where the... whatever-it-is... was found. Trying to suppress that knowledge would be motive for murder... if Mandl were obsessed enough.
Transporter Room, this is Lieutenant Yar. Two to beam up to Sickbay.
And just who tells visitors of those rules?
Any hat.
But I've seen no sign of... of police... those who enforce laws.
But they list nothing about punishment. That's what all this is about.
Careful, Commander, they've got some strange laws here...
Even a small thing? Such as ignoring a rule like "keep off the grass?"
Happiness to you!  It's like an "Eden" here.
I'll go along with you.
I've listed my report on their customs and laws, sir. Fairly simple, common sense things.
If you approve shore leave, sir, we could start with a small group at first.
It's a completely random selection?
It's a kind of syringe...
My pleasure.
Open, sir.
Sensor technicians are working on it, sir. They've identified it as a "glitch" in the system.
Sir, my sensors read it... well, as "half there." And it does look...
Their sun is almost down, sir.
Urgent, Enterprise. Please respond!
Wait, let's explain this...
What of justice to Wesley? Does he deserve to die?
Yes, Worf... but you've got to hear this.  Are you telling me that there's no crime here whatsoever? No one breaks any laws?
... and then we got him down to sickbay so Dr. Crusher could examine him.
And what I want now is gentleness. And joy. And love.
But I got out of uniform for you, Data. Do you know how old I was when I was abandoned?
But you already see better than I can.
Data! I'm only going to tell you this just once... It never happened.
Did he say when?
Five. Five years old, but I survived. I learned how to stay alive, how to avoid the rape gangs. I was fifteen before I escaped.
From you, Data. You are fully functional, aren't you?
Geordi -- my job is security...
Geordi...
How fully?
I need your advice. That's why I came to your quarters.
Lieutenant Yar in the Observation Lounge. Send a team here now.
Medical's been worried about you.
Never mind. I'll find what I need myself. Ship's Stores will have it.
No, sir. He was very upset... he kept talking about wanting normal eyes.
On clothes. You always wear such beautiful clothes off duty. And your hair's so nice all the time. I want to change my image.  What about this color?
Security team alert, pick up Lieutenant La Forge who left Sickbay moments ago.  Captain, anything further?
We'll talk about it, Geordi.  I'm going to take you to Sickbay now. All right?
Yes, helping is more important. How can I help you Geordi?
You jewel! That's exactly what I hoped.
You wanted me?
All language forms, sir.
Already set.
But Captain, firing on us was not an act of war?
Deflector shield power weakening, Captain.  Phasers ready, sir. Photon torpedoes ready...
Deflector shields failing, phasers going inoperative, sir...
Fifty seconds...
Hailing frequencies off.
Hailing frequencies open, sir.
Hailing frequencies open, sir.
Hailing frequency off, sir.
I say put all available power into a full-out combined phaser and photon torpedo salvo. Destroy their ability to sustain this forcefield, sir.
Just try it, shorty.
Negative, sir.
Not certain, sir. I'm getting very confusing readings.
Paws off, Ferengi.
Ready torpedoes, sir? There's enough power for a couple of them.
Sensor fluctuations in the energy readings from it, Captain.
Sensors read a power surge on their last maneuver, Captain.
Shields holding!
Ship's power drain is critical, Captain. I must now shut down our shields to maintain life support systems.
Stop! Hold it right there!
Suggest first strike, sir. Our shields now only have sixty-three seconds of power available before lowering.
That's much better, now over there...
They may be turning to fight!
What have bright, primal colors got to do with it?
What is going on?!
Which means something new has happened...
Commander.
Enough. We have people who need attention. We will not harm you, but we must help them.
He can't answer you, Captain.
We won't go without the shuttle crew.
What are you saying -- that you are going to deny us access to our comrades?
An alarm trigger or --
If you have the coordinates for where you think the hostages are, sir, we could just beam in there.
Is he hit?
Maybe his threats are just a way to bargain for what he wants....
No, sir.
Sir.  Transporter Room Three to Sickbay. Doctor Crusher, please report immediately with Medical Support Team.
Ah, Worf. I hope for your sake I met death with my eyes open. We are so much alike, you and I, both warriors, orphans who found ourselves this family.
Ben must have had no control left, otherwise he would have picked a better spot.

Captain Jean-Luc Picard. I can't say you've been like a father to me, because I never had one and I don't know what it feels like. But if I could choose someone in this universe to be like, someone who I would want to make proud of me, it's you. You who have the heart of an explorer and the soul of a poet. So you will understand when I say "Death is that state in which one exists only in the memory of others... which is why it is not an end."
Deanna... you are capable of so much love, you taught me without ever having to say a word. I realized I could be feminine without losing anything -- something I never thought I could achieve.
Enough. We have people who need attention. We mean you no harm, but do not interfere.
Geordi, in those moments I felt the most despair, you took my hand and made everything better. Your innate joy taught me to look beyond the moment.
I'm more concerned with Lieutenant Minnerly's kick-boxing.
If you'll meet me on the Holodeck later. I need your help on the Mishiama wrist-lock and break. If it works on you, I can use it on anyone.
Mister Data. Android... automaton... robot.  No. You see things with the wonder of a child, and that makes you more human than any of us. I love you just the way you are.
My friend, Beverly. True to yourself, your ideals. Your fierce devotion comes from within. It can't be diminished. From you I have learned to strive for excellence, no matter what the personal cost.
No idea. We'll go around. Just to be on the safe side.
Short-range sub-space radar confirms.
The aikido match is with Science Officer Swenson.
We won't without the shuttle crew.
We'll go the other way.

Welcome, my friends. You are here now watching this image of me because I have died. It probably happened while I was on duty, and quickly, which is what I expected, and what I wanted. Never forget I died doing exactly what I chose to do.
Wesley, I'm sorry that I won't be able to see you grow into the exceptional man you'll be. But I have my vision of who you are and your kindness and innocence is ageless.
What I want you to know is how much I loved my life... and each of you who shared it with me. You are my "family."
What are you saying -- that you are going to try and deny us access and attempt to force us to leave without our comrades?
Will Riker, you are the best. From the moment you beamed on board, you never failed me. You trusted me, you encouraged me and most of all, you made me laugh.
You bet on me.
A natural electrical charge... ?
Aye, sir.
Behave yourselves, Gentlemen.
But each peak gets lower and the valleys get deeper. Before you know it -- you're taking the drug not to feel good but to keep from feeling bad.
Captain -- I strongly recommend against anyone from this ship beaming over. The solar interference is too great.
Captain T'Jon -- are you there?
Captain, the tractor beam is available, if you want it.
Escort our "visitors" to the Observation Lounge.
Great. Activate your transporter. Set coordinates nine -- seven -- zero -- three... mark two... six... eight.
Hailing frequencies open.
Have them go to their own Transporter Room. It will be tricky, but perhaps I can link the two transporters in series and get them over with the increased power.
Hurry -- we're running out of time.
I can't maintain a positive lock.
I don't think they're going to make it.
I'm going to interconnect them.
I've got their initial transporter signal. Interlock complete.  Energize on my mark. Four -- three -- two -- one -- energize.

It doesn't feel artificial. It feels natural, good, and mind expanding.  Until the drug wears off. Then you pay the price. Once you come down, you're lower than when you started. So you take the drug again -- and it kicks you back up. But not as high this time.
It doesn't. But it makes you think it does.  You have to understand -- drugs can make you feel good.
It's too late.
No one wants to become dependent. That happens later.
Oh, lots of reasons... My home planet was a place of great poverty and violence. For some, the only escape was through drugs.
Reading six life forms...  But I can't get a solid lock.
Stop this! Now!
TWO -- SIX -- EIGHT.
That's the worst of it. You don't care. The drug is your salvation -- your survival. Nothing else is important.
The lock didn't hold, sir.
The solar flares are interfering with the tractor beam, Captain. I am unable to lock on.
The visual transmission is still breaking up.
Then all six of you get on the transporter platform -- on my signal, energize.
They put you on top of the world. You're happy... Sure of yourself. In control. A lot of people never feel that otherwise.
Too much interference.
Trying, sir.
Wesley, I hope you never do.
Worf -- how much time do we have?
Yes, and a difficult weapon to confiscate.
Yes.
You think the drug expands your universe -- but it actually shrinks it. Shrinks it to where you and the drug are all that's left.
A lot of changes, Lieutenant. A lot of changes.
And soon. Our sensors have picked up Klingon warships in this sector, Captain.

At least, with a tactical officer on board, they will have a chance to defend themselves well, Captain... it may be a matter of seconds or minutes... but those could be the minutes that change history...  Guinan says I died a senseless death in the other time line. I didn't like the sound of that, sir. I've always known the risks that come with a Starfleet uniform. If I am to die in one, I'd like my death to count for something.
Aye, sir.
But there's something more when you look at me, isn't there...
Captain Garrett is dead.
Captain Garrett says there were four Romulan warbirds. The Enterprise-C would be outmanned and outgunned...
Captain, I request a transfer to the Enterprise-C.
Captain, the Enterprise... C is sending out a distress call, sir. Audio only.
Damage control teams have all returned to the Enterprise-D... Captain.
Data, how different do you think your life would be in the other time line?
Deflector shield technology has advanced considerably during the war... our heat-dissipation rates are probably double those of the Enterprise-C, so we can hang in a firefight longer...
Do you know how?
Firing phasers...
First time for everything.
Four years. Straight out of the Academy. I was lucky to get the Enterprise.
Good-bye, Lieutenant.
Guinan, I have to know something.
Guinan... ?
How do you know your family's not still alive?
I am now. Captain Picard approved my request for transfer.
I felt it was necessary.
I just wanted to say good luck...
I know how important it is that they don't fail, Captain. That's why I'm requesting this transfer.
I know the mission. These are my orders, Lieutenant.
I was just thinking... a lot of things...  I've been working with one of the officers from the Enterprise-C... he's nice, you know? I like him. I'm worried about what's going to happen to him.
I wish there was more time.
I'm able to scan the interior of the ship now, sir... heavy damage to warp field nacelles and hull bearing struts... internal space frame --  Life-signs, Captain!
I'm getting too much interference, Captain.
I'm not supposed to be here. I'm not supposed to be alive.
I'm on my way, sir.  Good-bye, Captain.
I'm reading forty percent on forward shields... what do you have on aft...
I'm sure our coordinates have been transmitted to the Klingon command... we must not remain here.
I've seen it in your eyes, Guinan. We've known each other too long...
It's clearing, Captain. Definitely a Federation starship... accessing registry...
It's just that I've never seen anything bother her before...
Just a couple of T-K-L meal rations... we're in a hurry.  Oh, this is, Lieutenant Castillo...
Kind of scary, isn't it?
Let's take a look at the torpedo launchers...
Lieutenant Tasha Yar reporting for duty, sir.
Lieutenant... ?
N, C, C, one-seven-oh-one... C. U.S.S.... Enterprise.
No. Captain Garrett belongs on that ship. But now that she's dead, there's a certain logic in this request.
Not yet... Is something wrong, Guinan?
Oh... Deck six... sorry...
Okay, Castillo.
Permission to remain for a moment, sir...
Photon banks are depleted... auxiliary fusion generators are down...
Readings are sporadic... looks like they have massive casualties, but some are still alive.
Richard.
She was the first Galaxy Class warship built by the Federation... forty-two decks... capable of transporting over six thousand troops...
Shields are up. Functioning.
Shields up. Charging weapon systems.
Sir, I don't belong here.
So much for lunch.
Standard rations. Food replicators are on minimum power...
Thank you, sir.
That's me, Captain.
That's not going to do... Commander, advise Lieutenant La Forge that shields are below minimum...
They need someone at Tactical.
Voice message has ended, Captain. All I'm receiving now is their automated distress signal.
We've finished the transfer of equipment, Captain. The new converters should be able to compensate for the damaged units on the Enterprise-C.
What are the status readouts on main phaser banks?
What happens to me in the other time line?
Where am I supposed to be?
Yeah.
You may not like the future. It's been a long war. The Federation's lost more than half of Starfleet to the Klingons.
You need me. Show me someone on your crew that can do the job better than I can.
You'll do fine.
You're gonna need it, Lieutenant...
Your ship has a lot more maneuverability than the Romulan counterparts of that era... in fact, if you could isolate...
